## Register the Google Root TLS certificate in the Gateway

1. Open the Docker Compose file of the Gateway: `get-started/docker-compose/docker-compose.yml`
2. Add the following environment variables to the `ssg` service under the `environment` section:
  - CERT_0: ""
  - CERT_0_TRUST_ANCHOR: "true"
  - CERT_0_TRUSTED_FOR_SIGNING_SERVER_CERTS: "true"
  - CERT_0_VERIFY_HOSTNAME: "false"

  *Note: CERT_0 contains the Google Internet Authority G2 certificate encoded in base64*

  *Note 2: the certificate will expire on December 31st, 2018. You can download a
  newer version from https://pki.google.com/GIAG2.crt*

3. Update the Gateway with the new configuration: `docker-compose -f docker-compose.yml -f docker-compose.dockercloudproxy.yml up -d ssg`
